noun.description: A substance obtained from vanilla beans or produced artificially and used to flavor sweet foods or to impart a fragrant scent to cosmetic preparations.
A tropical climbing orchid that has fragrant flowers and long podlike fruit.

adjective.description: Having no special or extra features; ordinary or standard.
examples: choosing plain vanilla technology wherever you can will save you money
the original, vanilla MP3 format is still the most commonly encountered form of the technology
they seem to be quite content in their plain vanilla domestic life

origin: Mid 17th century: from Spanish vainilla pod, diminutive of vaina sheath, pod, from Latin vagina sheath. The spelling change was due to association with French vanille.
